text: The Hams Bluff Light is an historic lighthouse on Saint Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands. It was first lit in 1915 under the Danish Government. It was since transferred to the United States Lighthouse Service and later came under the jurisdiction of the United States Coast Guard. The historic tower has been abandoned; the beacon is now mounted on an adjacent new truss tower. The light displays two white flashes every 30 seconds at a focal plane of .NOAA Nautical Chart 25644 "Frederksted Road" The lighthouse was listed on the United States National Register of Historic Places in 2019. title: Hams Bluff Light
